pr_title: [BEAM-10967] adding validate runner for Dataflow runner v2 to Java SDK

timeline.message: [BEAM-10967] adding validate runner for Dataflow runner v2 to Java SDK

+package org.apache.beam.sdk.testing;
+
+import org.apache.beam.sdk.annotations.Internal;
+
+/** Category tag for sick-baying validation tests which are incompatible with Dataflow Runner V2. */
+@Internal
+public interface RunnerV2Incompatible {}

timeline.bodyText: Dataflow Runner V2 supports several items in the commonExcludeCategories like map state, bundle finalizer, test stream. Please only exclude tests that are excluded within google.
timeline.author: lukecwik
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -227,6 +227,34 @@ task validatesRunner {
   dependsOn validatesRunnerLegacyWorkerTest
 }
 
+task validatesRunnerV2Test(type: Test) {
+  group = "Verification"
+  dependsOn buildAndPushDockerContainer
+
+  systemProperty "beamTestPipelineOptions", JsonOutput.toJson([
+          "--runner=TestDataflowRunner",
+          "--project=${dataflowProject}",
+          "--region=${dataflowRegion}",
+          "--tempRoot=${dataflowValidatesTempRoot}",
+          "--workerHarnessContainerImage=${dockerImageContainer}:${dockerTag}",
+          "--experiments=beam_fn_api,use_unified_worker",
+  ])
+
+  // Increase test parallelism up to the number of Gradle workers. By default this is equal
+  // to the number of CPU cores, but can be increased by setting --max-workers=N.
+  maxParallelForks Integer.MAX_VALUE
+  classpath = configurations.validatesRunner
+  testClassesDirs = files(project(":sdks:java:core").sourceSets.test.output.classesDirs) +
+          files(project(project.path).sourceSets.test.output.classesDirs)
+  useJUnit {
+    includeCategories 'org.apache.beam.sdk.testing.ValidatesRunner'
+    excludeCategories 'org.apache.beam.sdk.testing.RunnerV2Incompatible'
+    commonExcludeCategories.each {

replies.bodyText: I will make the stronger statement that I prefer to not use a "commonExcludeCategories" as it is not self documenting and not causal. Only if there is a shared cause for not supporting something should you share the list of exclusions. Otherwise each exclusion overlaps only by coincidence and should not be shared but listed separately.
replies.author: kennknowles

timeline.bodyText:
Is the purpose of this job jenkins job to run Java, Go and Python ValidatesRunner tests, it not we should include Java in the name somewhere.
nit: Dataflow_V2 -> DataflowV2
timeline.author: lukecwik
timeline.diffHunk:

+import CommonJobProperties as commonJobProperties
+import PostcommitJobBuilder
+
+
+// This job runs the suite of ValidatesRunner tests against the Dataflow
+// runner V2.
+PostcommitJobBuilder.postCommitJob('beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow_V2',
+    'Run Dataflow_V2 ValidatesRunner', 'Google Cloud Dataflow Runner V2 ValidatesRunner Tests', this) {

replies.bodyText: Found that we already have Python DataflowV2 validate runner tests so I edited the code to follow the same naming convention.
replies.author: ihji

timeline.message: rename jenkins task, individually sickbaying tests

timeline.bodyText: We should not tag tests with this, but have an exclude list in the build file.
timeline.author: kennknowles
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,24 @@

+package org.apache.beam.sdk.testing;
+
+import org.apache.beam.sdk.annotations.Internal;
+
+/** Category tag for sick-baying validation tests which are incompatible with Dataflow Runner V2. */
+@Internal
+public interface DataflowRunnerV2Incompatible {}

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, I agree. By having a list of excluded tests in a single place, we could better manage them in future. I considered that in my first draft but failed to find the way to exclude specific test methods. It looks like Gradle JUnit plugin only supports categorical exclusion and the minimal unit of exclusion supported by Gradle test task is a class (and it's still too coarse).
Do you know any other good solution to this?
replies.author: ihji

replies.bodyText:
I think it should work. Here is an example where I did it: 
  
    
      beam/runners/portability/java/build.gradle
    
    
         Line 162
      in
      c0755cd
    
    
    
    

        
          
           excludeTestsMatching 'org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.ParDoLifecycleTest.testTeardownCalledAfterExceptionInFinishBundle'
replies.author: kennknowles
